column5: Yes, it appears that the outfitters were given some unofficial advance notice, but not a specific date. My lodge called me on Friday to say they were told the border would re-open "mid-August". Of course our trip was scheduled for July 31 - August 7th. We rescheduled for the second week of September. Woohoo, we're going to Canada. Airfare also went up $150 per ticket since yesterday, but we had to wait for confirmation from the Canadian government. It's worth it.
This is probably the best day of the mods lives! 🤣🤣
Ya the mods are probably sucking down a few cold ones now.

So good for me that I have a place in Canada and I can name my cabin as my quarantine spot but what are travelers going to use if the only have a place to stay for a week. All travelers are required to have a quarantine plan to be able to enter. Not sure how this is going to work.
I'm sure the border wants to keep it fairly simple to cross and not rocket science,they want it to go smoothly just like the person crossing does.

I have a feeling if they don’t feel you meet the requirements you might as well turn around. I am in BC for a month but I am driving across the country in my truck. I will be staying alone in AirBnbs. If they need anymore quarantine plan than that I was not meant to be in Canada
This makes me very happy to hear. I have a trip booked for August 7th-14th, so it could get kind of tricky

This Vermont Post is wrong. You must take a Covid Test within 72 Hours of entering Canada even if you are Fully Vaccinated. This is the Criteria for entering Canada as per the Canada Government Website!
What will the quarantine plan look like we are responsible for? I wonder if you will still need to present a plan if you are exempt.
They better get those fires under control or there might not be any place to go. This is sioux narrows area.
August the 9th. is the opening date . The US residents need to prove that they have receive both shots 14 days +
Link, source?
No link but I just watched the live press conference on CTV
Found s source...The Canadian Press
https://www.washingtonpost.com/world...s-border-open/Vaccinated and requires a negative Covid-19 test with in 72 hours of crossing.Sent from my SM-A505U using Tapatalk
Here is a link.https://www.compassvermont.com/news/...c139df0c4.html
Great news. For the COVID tests that you have to show within 72 hours, can you buy the kit at Walgreens or do you have to go to a clinic as I’m not sure what is accepted or not.

1. Don't take my word for it. Watch for official announcements. 2. Last I saw the requirement was for a molecular test, not an antigen test. 3. Here's a website with testing sites in Minnesota. I'm looking for the nasal swab molecular (or maybe pcr, we'll see what they say). https://mn.gov/covid19/get-tested/te...ions/index.jsp 4. Good idea to test 48 hours in advance in case there's a false positive and you need retesting the next day.
By the way, I just got a call from my outfitter and he's floating on air and his phone is ringing off the hook.
Links:https://www.canada.ca/en/public-heal...nts-of-th.html Pre-entry testing requirements:https://travel.gc.ca/travel-covid/tr...ng-into-canada
